alert.note: Alert for North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 339 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Iron Mountain, or 29 miles northeast of Laramie, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
